name: heat and power co-generation, oil | electricity, high voltage | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/13201/documentation

This dataset represents the production of high voltage electricity and district heat at a grid-connected oil power plant with a capacity of 500 MW on the world in 2012. ;Emissions are in general calculated/estimated based on the fuel oil type S, European quality. This dataset has been built on the basis of oil electricity production datasets in version 2 of the ecoinvent database which were elaborated by N. Jungbluth 2007 (see main publication in modelling and administrative).   Nothing else than the efficiency has been adjusted in this dataset; besides that no new data collection has taken place;Comments:; - sulfur content of the oil is not adapted to local/average conditions.; - CO2 emissions are presented for the combustion and for the flue gas treatment; -  Extensive comments on emissions can be found in Jungbluth 2007, on which this dataset is based on.;Emissions to the water are from flue gas treatment. Most of these data come from two power plants in Portugal (EDP 2001) and data from Slowakia;EDP (2001) Environmental Report 2000. Electricidade de Portugal, S.A., Lisboa, PT, retrieved from: www.edp.pt.;Slovenské elektrárne (2002) Environment Report 2001, Bratislave, SK, retrieved from: www.seas.sk.;IEA/OECD. 2010. Electricity Information 2010. International Energy Agency (IEA), Paris Cedex (FR). Part IV. Detailed OECD Electricity And Heat Data.;[This dataset is meant to replace the following datasets:]

From the constructed power plant ready to produce electricity and from the fuel ready to be used.

This activity ends with 1MJ of heavy fuel oil burned in power plant with heat and electricity as main products. 

This dataset includes all energy use, use of chemicals, emissions to air and water including treatment of flue gasses and effluents. In an oil power plant, water is needed for cooling, feed water for the steam circuit, for the flue gas treatment, or other cleaning. This dataset only considers water use (evaporation) for cooling and steam circuit.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The Annual Production Volume is valid for the year 2012.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Electricity and heat production in a conventional combined heat and power oil power plant with a capacity of 500 MWe
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Data are originally from sources from the 90ies. Uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.

exchanges.description: Electricity output per MJ of oil burned.

exchanges.description:
Estimation with literature data, basic uncertainty estimated = 3
Amount was scaled to the amount of reference product.
Calculated based on literature (Scown, C.D., et al., 2011, Water Footprint of U.S. Trasportation Fuels;Scown, C.D., et al., 2011, Water Footprint of U.S. Trasportation Fuels (SI); Stiegel, 2008, Estimating Freshwater Needs to Meet Future Thermoelectric Generation Requirements; Floerke, M., 2009, Future changes of freshwater needs in the electricity production sector), (Vionnet, S., Quantis Water Database - Technical Report, 2012). Water use in this process is modelled based on literature (see references). The process boundaries are given by the boundaries of the power plant. The process ends when the energy (MJ) is produced and ready to be used for electricity production (kWh).
Calculated based on literature data. 9.7 MJ is calculated efficiency of the electricity production, average of all available regions.
